org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.core.api

Interface WebSocketListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WebSocketAdapter

    public interface WebSocketListener
    Basic WebSocket Listener interface for incoming WebSocket events.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onWebSocketBinary(byte[] payload, int offset, int len)
      A WebSocket binary frame has been received.
      void onWebSocketClose(int statusCode, String reason)
      A Close Event was received.
      void onWebSocketConnect(WebSocketConnection connection)

      void onWebSocketException(WebSocketException error)

      A WebSocket Text frame was received.

    • Method Detail

      • onWebSocketBinary

        void onWebSocketBinary(byte[] payload,
                     int offset,
                     int len)
        A WebSocket binary frame has been received.
        Parameters:
        payload - the raw payload array received
        offset - the offset in the payload array where the data starts
        len - the length of bytes in the payload

      • onWebSocketClose

        void onWebSocketClose(int statusCode,
                    String reason)
        A Close Event was received.

        The underlying WebSocketConnection will be considered closed at this point.

        Parameters:
        statusCode - the close status code. (See StatusCode)
        reason - the optional reason for the close.

      • onWebSocketConnect

        void onWebSocketConnect(WebSocketConnection connection)
        A WebSocketConnection has connected successfully and is ready to be used.

        Note: It is a good idea to track this connection as a field in your object so that you can write messages back.

        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to use to send messages on.

      • onWebSocketException

        void onWebSocketException(WebSocketException error)
        A WebSocket exception has occurred.

        Usually this occurs from bad / malformed incoming packets. (example: bad UTF8 data, frames that are too big, violations of the spec)

        This will result in the WebSocketConnection being closed by the implementing side.

        Note: you will receive no onWebSocketClose(int, String) as this condition results in the API calling BaseConnection.close(int, String) for you.

        Parameters:
        error - the error that occurred.

      • onWebSocketText

        void onWebSocketText(String message)
        A WebSocket Text frame was received.
        Parameters:
        message -
